page.title: 05BBC Monitoring at Caversham
page.content: The job of the BBC Monitoring Service is to provide speedy and accurate reports of significant news and comment from foreign broadcasting stations in all parts of the world.It is a national service supplying information not only to the BBC itself but also to government departments,the Press,and other bodies concerned with international affairs.The monitoring service based near Reading at Caversham Park,has two main departments_Reception which is responsible for the listening and transcription,and News and Publications which selects and edits material for sending out by teleprinter and in printed documents to numerous recipients.About 500 to 600 people work at BBC Caversham _ at least 100 monitors,then Editors and canteen people and gardeners.
